intro: Satureja atheniensis, commonly known as Greek thyme, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with small, oval-shaped leaves that have a strong, pungent fragrance. Its flowers are pink to purple in color and are arranged in whorls along the stems. Satureja atheniensis is often used in traditional herbal medicine and as a culinary herb due to its essential oils and antioxidant properties.
